result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin A Lamarche

records.addlTxt: 02:11 PM; Case called to tag along wtih 21CF618 & 21TR2210 as this case was dismissed and read in.  Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:22 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing and Preliminary hearing.  Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a preliminary hearing waiver has been filed.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of preliminary hearing.  Atty. Kershek acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding today.  Atty. Kershek is asking to proceed to a plea only and adjourn for sentencing to allow time for the defendant to complete some treatment first.  Court will proceed with the plea only today and adjourn for sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Kershek confirms the offer.  Pursuant to the offer the Court orders this case dismissed and read into 21CF618.  Calendar call scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:32 AM; Case called for Hearing with defendant's other matters. Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charles Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes this matter still need to have the preliminary hearing.  Atty. Kershek is asking the court to continue to toll time limits, will proceed with a waiver at the next court date and asks the matter be set for plea and sentencing with the defendant's other matters. Court will continue to toll time limits.  Court will adjourn the matter for waiver of preliminary hearing and plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:29 AM Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
